Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Pottery Drinking Cup of Kylix Style
Description: A pottery drinking cup of kylix style; this style was constant in form all through the Hellenistic period. The bowl is a little wider and less deep than that of other drinking cups. At the top of the bowl there are two horizontal handles. The bowl is supported on a moderately high circular foot.
